title: Module 4 Landscape Ecology & Spatial Analysis Checkpoint

questions.prompt: Functional connectivity differs from structural connectivity because it emphasizes:
questions.explanation: Functional connectivity reflects movement behavior and matrix permeability.

questions.prompt: Select tools or approaches explicitly associated with corridor/connectivity analysis in this module.
questions.explanation: Connectivity work combines resistance surfaces, paths/circuits, and network analysis.

questions.prompt: Give one limitation of NDVI as a biodiversity or ecosystem proxy.
questions.explanation: NDVI is useful but indirect and can saturate or miss community-level detail.

questions.prompt: MaxEnt is primarily used for which task?
questions.explanation: MaxEnt is a core SDM method for occurrence/background data.

questions.prompt: If habitat cover drops from 40% to 30% of a landscape, what is the absolute decline in percentage points?
Name one reason spatial autocorrelation can bias SDM evaluation.
questions.explanation: Nearby points share environment, violating independence assumptions.
